document.docAuthor: Erman, Orhan, Gülle, Pinar, Özkan, Muhlis, Candoğan, Hülya & Boyaci, Yunus Ömer
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia) of Turkey: First supplement

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the water mites (Acari: Hydrachnidia) of Turkey: First supplement

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: Eastern Europe, Asia and Turkey .

Remark: In the list of
Erman et al. 2010
inadvertently not included.
Habitat: Streams, possibly with a preference for hygropetric habitats.
Records from Turkey : Erzincan Province (Esen et al. 2013a).
Distribution: Alps, Germany , Pyrenees and Turkey .
Records from Turkey : Bingöl Province (Esen & Erman 2013).
Records from Turkey : Erzincan Province (Esen et al. 2013a).
Records from Turkey : Erzincan Province (Esen et al. 2013).
Distribution: Central Europe, Alps, central mediterranean region, Balkans and Turkey .

bibRefCitation.author: Gulle, P. & Gulle, I. & Boyaci, Y. O.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gulle, P., Gulle, I. & Boyaci, Y. O. (2015) A new Atractides Koch (Acari: Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae) species from southwest- ern Turkey. Zootaxa, 3957 (2), 246 - 248. https: // doi. org / 10.11646 / zootaxa. 3957.2.11

subSubSection.paragraph: Habitat: Pristine spring with dense emergent vegetation with sandy and muddy bottom.
Records from Turkey : Erzurum Province (Esen & Erman, 2016).
Distribution: Northern Africa; central, western and southern Europe and Turkey .
Records from Turkey : Isparta Province ( Gülle & Boyacı 2014 ).
Habitat: Seepage waters fed by springs.
Records from Turkey : Siirt Province (Esen et al. 2014).
Habitat: Stagnant parts rich in aquatic plants of streams.
Habitat: Rhitrobiontic species, inhabiting lower, middle and high order streams, as well as rheocrenes in lowland and low mountain ranges.

bibRefCitation.author: Pesic, V. & Asadi, M. & Cimpean, M. & Dabert, M. & Esen, Y. & Gerecke, R. & Martin, P. & Savic, A. & Smit, H. & Stur, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Pesic, V., Asadi, M., Cimpean, M., Dabert, M., Esen, Y., Gerecke, R., Martin, P., Savic, A., Smit, H. & Stur, E. (2017) Six spe- cies in one: evidence of cryptic speciation in Hygrobates fluviatilis complex (Acariformes, Hydrachnidia, Hygrobatidae). Systematic and Applied Acarology, 22 (9), 1327 - 1377. https: // doi. org / 10.11158 / saa. 22.9.4

subSubSection.paragraph: Habitat: Rhitrobiontic species, inhabiting lower, middle and high order streams.
